An aggrieved
			 individual may bring an action in a court of competent jurisdiction, asserting
			 a violation of this Act. Aggrieved individuals may be awarded all appropriate
			 relief, including equitable relief, and a monetary award of $1,000 per
			 violation, plus reasonable attorneys’ fees, or such higher amount as may be
			 appropriate in the case of an established pattern or practice of such
			 failures.

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the lender or servicer of a home mortgage,
		  upon a request by the homeowner for a short sale, to make a prompt decision
		  whether to allow the sale.
